body: \text{Define a determinant and explain its significance in solving linear equations.}
\text{Calculate the determinant of the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ -1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{Explain the properties of determinants of order 2 and provide examples.}
\text{Evaluate } \begin{vmatrix} 3 & -1 & 4 \\ 2 & 0 & 5 \\ 1 & 3 & 6 \end{vmatrix}.
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find the value of } |A|.
\text{Show that the determinant of a triangular matrix is the product of its diagonal elements.}
\text{Calculate the determinant of } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & 4 \\ 5 & 2 & 0 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{Find the area of the triangle with vertices at } (1, 2), (3, 5), \text{ and } (4, -1).
\text{Evaluate the determinant } \begin{vmatrix} 0 & \sin \theta & -\cos \theta \\ -\sin \theta & 0 & \cos \theta \\ \cos \theta & -\sin \theta & 0 \end{vmatrix}.
\text{If } |A| = 5, \text{ find the value of } |3A| \text{ for a 3x3 matrix } A.
\text{Explain how determinants are used to check the consistency of a system of linear equations.}
\text{Evaluate } \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & -2 \\ -1 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & -3 & 1 \end{vmatrix}.
\text{Find the values of } x \text{ for which the system } \begin{cases} 2x + y = 5 \\ x - 3y = -2 \end{cases} \text{ has no unique solution.}
\text{If the determinant of a matrix } A \text{ is zero, what does this imply about } A \text{?}
\text{Find the minors and cofactors of each element in } \begin{bmatrix} 4 & 3 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{Verify that } \begin{vmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 4 & -6 \end{vmatrix} = 0 \text{ and interpret the result.}
\text{Show that the points } (1, 2), (3, 4), (5, 6) \text{ are collinear using determinants.}
\text{Find the inverse of } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ using determinants.}
\text{Compute } \begin{vmatrix} x & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix} \text{ and solve for } x \text{ if the determinant is 5.}
\text{Explain how to find the area of a triangle using determinants if given the vertices.}
\text{Evaluate } \begin{vmatrix} 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & -1 & 4 \\ 2 & 3 & 5 \end{vmatrix}.
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix} \text{, show that } |A| = 0.
\text{Prove that } \begin{vmatrix} \cos \theta & \sin \theta \\ -\sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{vmatrix} = 1.
\text{If } |A| = 7, \text{ find } |A^{-1}|.
\text{Use determinants to show that the points } (3, 0), (7, 2), (9, 6) \text{ are collinear.}
\text{Evaluate } \begin{vmatrix} \sin x & \cos x \\ \cos x & -\sin x \end{vmatrix}.
\text{Find the value of } k \text{ if the determinant } \begin{vmatrix} 3 & k \\ 5 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 10.
\text{Evaluate the determinant } \begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 & 2 \\ 0 & 5 & -1 \\ 7 & 2 & -6 \end{vmatrix}.
\text{If } |A| = -2 \text{ for a 2x2 matrix, find } |2A|.
\text{Show that the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix} \text{ is its own inverse.}
